meanings.definition: To direct (a film, play, etc.) jointly with another person.
meanings.sent1: The two friends were codirecting a school play together.
meanings.sent2: The filmmakers were codirecting the new movie project.
meanings.sent3: Codirecting the play turned out to be a fun and creative experience for both.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was codirecting her own life's story.
meanings.sent5: The siblings were codirecting a surprise birthday party for their parents.

meanings.definition: The act of directing something jointly with another person.
meanings.sent1: Codirecting requires good communication and teamwork.
meanings.sent2: The codirecting of the project led to a successful outcome.
meanings.sent3: The codirecting of the event made it more enjoyable and efficient.
meanings.sent4: Their codirecting partnership was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The codirecting of the play brought out the best in both directors.
